info.csv_title: Nokia Siemens NSS M14.5;M14.5IP;M14.4;M14.4IP;M14.3;M14.3IP;M14.2;M14.2IP;M14.1;M14.1IP;M14.0;M14.0IP;M13.6;M13.6IP;M13.5;M13.5IP;M13.4;M13.4IP;M13.3;M13.3IP;M13.2;M13.2IP;M13.1;M13.1IP;M13;M13IP;M12;M12IP M384 UPD measurement dump

kpi_info.title: period_duration
kpi_info.use: Duration of the measurement period in minutes.

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_REJ
kpi_info.use:
Number of the call attempts (0...65535) terminated by the MGW. The other MGW may be used after this failure. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C3) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C3+M384B4C3) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_ATT
kpi_info.use:
Number of call attempts (0...9999999). The field is updated when the resource is released. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C4) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C4+M384B4C4) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ANSWERED_CALLS
kpi_info.use:
The number of calls (0...999999) that have reached the conversation state. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C5) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C5+M384B4C5) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_1
kpi_info.use:
All calls are grouped on the basis of clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command. Note that the user plane destination measurement uses the same clear code grouping as the traffic category measurement. Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in user plane destination measurement. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C6) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C6+M384B4C6) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_2
kpi_info.use:
All calls are grouped on the basis of clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command. Note that the user plane destination measurement uses the same clear code grouping as traffic category measurement. Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in the user plane destination measurement. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C7) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C7+M384B4C7) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_6

Note that the user plane destination measurement uses same clear code grouping as the traffic category measurement. The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C11) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C11+M384B4C11) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_7
kpi_info.use:
All calls are grouped on the basis of the clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command. Note that the user plane destination measurement uses the same clear code grouping as the traffic category measurement. Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in the user plane destination measurement. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C12) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C12+M384B4C12) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_8
kpi_info.use:
All calls are grouped on the basis of the clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command. Note that the user plane destination measurement uses same clear code grouping as the traffic category measurement. Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in the user plane destination measurement. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C13) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C13+M384B4C13) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ERLANGS_X100
kpi_info.use:
The amount of traffic in the media gateway in erlangs (0.0...999999.9). That means the total reservation time of the measured object in relation to the results accumulation period. The seizure-time value is rounded off to the nearest second. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]
Note: either the common (M384B2C14) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C14+M384B4C14) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_DATA_PROV_RESTARTED
kpi_info.use:
Tag appears with value 1 when the data provider in the signalling unit or the signalling unit(s) is restarted during the period and data might not be reliable. Measured objects:
The measured object is the MGW. [Nickname: MGWNAME]
The measured object is the user plane destination. [Nickname: UPD]

kpi_info.title: UPD_RING_IN
kpi_info.use:
The number of incoming calls that have reached the ringing phase. The measured object is the incoming traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0 to 9999999.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_SUCC_TR_X100_IN
kpi_info.use:
The successful call duration. The measured object is the incoming traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0.0 to 999999.9, it is given in ERLANGS. The Successful traffic is the cumulative time between the Alerting / ACM and Release complete message. The value of counter in the xml report is 100 x incoming successful traffic.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_ANSW_TR_X100_IN
kpi_info.use:
The answered call duration. The measured object is the incoming traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0.0 to 999999.9, it is given in ERLANGS. The Successful traffic is the cumulative time between the CONNECT ACK / Answer and the Release Complete message. The value of counter in the xml report is 100 x incoming answer traffic.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_RING_OUT
kpi_info.use:
The number of incoming calls that have reached the ringing phase. The measured object is the outgoing traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0 to 9999999.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_SUCC_TR_X100_OUT
kpi_info.use:
The successful call duration. The measured object is the outgoing traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0.0 to 999999.9, it is given in ERLANGS. The Successful traffic is the cumulative time between the Alerting / ACM and Release complete message. The value of counter in the xml report is 100 x outgoing successful traffic.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_ANSW_TR_X100_OUT
kpi_info.use:
The answered call duration. The measured object is the outgoing traffic on the given UPD. The possible values range from 0.0 to 999999.9, it is given in ERLANGS. The Successful traffic is the cumulative time between the CONNECT ACK / Answer and the Release Complete message. The value of counter in the xml report is 100 x outgoing answer traffic.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_REJ_IN
kpi_info.use:
Number of incoming call attempts terminated by the MGW. The other MGW is used after this failure.
The MSC Server controls several MGWs. When the first one rejects the resource reservation for some reason and the next MGW is tried, this counter is updated.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C3) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C3+M384B4C3) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_ATT_IN
kpi_info.use:
Number of incoming call attempts.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C4) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C4+M384B4C4) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ANSWERED_CALLS_IN
kpi_info.use:
Number of incoming calls which have reached the conversation state.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C5) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C5+M384B4C5) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_1_IN
kpi_info.use:
All calls are grouped on the basis of clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command.
Note that the UPD measurement uses the same clear code grouping as the Traffic ategory measurement.
Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in UPD measurement.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C6) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C6+M384B4C6) are printed in the report.

Note: either the common (M384B2C7) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C7+M384B4C7) are printed in the report.

Note: either the common (M384B2C11) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C11+M384B4C11) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_7_IN
kpi_info.use:

Note that the UPD measurement uses the same clear code grouping as the Traffic ategory measurement.

Note: either the common (M384B2C13) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C13+M384B4C13) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ERLANGS_x100_IN
kpi_info.use:
The amount of incoming traffic in the media gateway in erlangs. That means the total reservation time of the measured object in relation to the result accumulation period.
The seizure time is rounded off to the nearest second.Value is multiplied by 100.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C14) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C14+M384B4C14) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_REJ_OUT
kpi_info.use:
Number of the outgoing call attempts terminated by the MGW. The other MGW is used after this failure.
The MSC Server controls several MGWs. When the first one rejects the resource reservation for some reason and the next MGW is tried, this counter is updated.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C3) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C3+M384B4C3) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_NUM_OF_CALL_ATT_OUT
kpi_info.use:
Number of outgoing call attempts.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C4) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C4+M384B4C4) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ANSWERED_CALLS_OUT
kpi_info.use:
Number of outgoing calls that have reached the conversation state.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C5) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C5+M384B4C5) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_CLEAR_CODE_1_OUT

All calls are grouped on the basis of clear code grouping that the user has determined (maximum 10 digits). The grouping of clear codes can be changed with the TMH MML command.
Note that the UPD measurement uses the same clear code grouping as the Traffic ategory measurement.
Note that the clear code grouping in field reporting does not apply to clear code grouping in UPD measurement.

Note: either the common (M384B2C6) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C6+M384B4C6) are printed in the report.

kpi_info.title: UPD_ERLANGS_x100_OUT
kpi_info.use:
The amount of outgoing traffic in the media gateway in erlangs. That means the total reservation time of the measured object in relation to the result accumulation period.
The seizure time is rounded off to the nearest second. Value is multiplied by 100.
Measured object: MSC / MGWMNAME / UPD
Note: either the common (M384B2C14) or the separated IN/OUT counters (M384B3C14+M384B4C14) are printed in the report.
